instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Graphic Distortion when pressure is applied on bottom of board
threads.message: In the past few years I have come across a couple different <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B 13" 2012 Unibody MacBook Pros that have an interesting issue, The system will function just fine and pass all standard Apple Tests however when pressure is applied to the bottom of the logic board right under where the CPU is attached the screen becomes distorted and the system Crashes/Glitches and becomes unstable. Is this possibly due to bad solder points on the bottom of the CPU? Has anyone run into this problem and can shed some light on this issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Graphic Distortion when pressure is applied on bottom of board
threads.message: Bad CPU-side ("bottom") RAM slot. Common on that model board. Leave bottom slot empty and max-out the top slot. Not really (economically) repairable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Graphic Distortion when pressure is applied on bottom of board
threads.message: If the RAM slot trick does not help the board is trash, there is no fix for this.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Graphic Distortion when pressure is applied on bottom of board
threads.message: Thanks for the tip, Looks as if this was indeed the issue. Now from what I have seen on this forum this issue is not repairable correct?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Graphic Distortion when pressure is applied on bottom of board
threads.message: I mean, it's certainly repairable (with the proper equipment and know-how, and several hours of work), but not worth the time/effort. Just use the top slot and save yourself the trouble.
